snippet: A 101-year-old Manhattan woman’s death is an example of what officials say is the danger of older people living in buildings that still lack power.
abstract: Death of a 101-year-old Manhattan woman is an example of what officials say is the danger of older people living in buildings that still lack power; Federal Emergency Management Agency officials are urging city authorities to provide alternate accommodations to residents of public housing, where many seniors have been living without heat since Hurricane Sandy.

byline.contributor: Winnie Hu, Randy Leonard and Jeffrey E. Singer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A 101-year-old Manhattan woman’s death is an example of what officials say is the danger of older people living in buildings that still lack power.

headline.seo: For Elderly, Power Loss Carries Extra Peril
headline.main: For Elderly, Extra Peril Accompanies Power Loss
headline.print_headline: For Elderly, Extra Peril Accompanies Power Loss
